meanings.sent1: The shiny new toys were saleable in the store.
meanings.sent2: The farmer's fresh produce was always saleable at the market.
meanings.sent3: The talking parrot thought it was saleable to the highest bidder.
meanings.sent4: Her infectious laughter was as saleable as a rare gem.
meanings.sent5: The delicious aroma of freshly baked bread made it highly saleable.

meanings.sent1: The antique furniture was saleable at a high price.
meanings.sent2: The old books in the library were not very saleable.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten believed it was saleable to the pet store.
meanings.sent4: His talent for painting made his artwork incredibly saleable.
meanings.sent5: The rare stamp collection was extremely saleable among collectors.

meanings.sent1: The surplus inventory was saleable to other retailers.
meanings.sent2: The damaged goods were no longer saleable in the store.
meanings.sent3: The magical potion claimed to make anything saleable.
meanings.sent4: His persuasive skills made even the most challenging products saleable.
meanings.sent5: The unique handmade crafts were highly saleable at the craft fair.
